meanings.definition: A network of fungal threads or hyphae.
meanings.sent1: The mycele spread throughout the soil, connecting different parts of the fungus.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the mycele to understand how fungi grow and spread.
meanings.sent3: The mycele threw a party for all the other fungi in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The mycele acted like a bridge, linking one side of the forest to the other.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the mycele looked like a delicate web of interconnected threads.

meanings.definition: The vegetative part of a fungus, consisting of a mass of branching, thread-like hyphae.
meanings.sent1: In the dark, damp forest, the mycele of the mushroom quietly grew.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully observed the mycele of the mold spreading on the bread.
meanings.sent3: The mycele of the fungus decided to throw a surprise party for the mushrooms.
meanings.sent4: The mycele of knowledge expanded in her mind, branching out into new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The mycele of the fungus was like a hidden city beneath the forest floor, bustling with activity.
